alert.note: Alert for Morgan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:03PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morgan and northwestern Washington Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 503 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Brush, or 10 miles southeast of Fort Morgan, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Morgan, Akron, Brush, Log Lane Village, Gary, Platner, Twelve-Mile Corner, Midway and Adena School. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
